pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### Import summary

No significant changes to the import graph

Great idea! I'd like to suggest four further metrics, at least for the near future.
- number of documentation `nolints`s: almost all of them are genuine at this point
Computing them can be as simple as `cat scripts/nolints.json | grep -c "docBlame"`.
- number of large files (as flagged by the style linter): long-term, this metric may cease to be useful, as a few transient exceptions are presumably normal. In my opinion, we're not at this point yet.) Can be computed using `cat scripts/style-exceptions.txt | grep -c "ERR_NUM_LIN"` (currently 97); using `git grep` would also work.
- number of missing module docstrings: `cat scripts/style-exceptions.txt | grep -c "ERR_MOD"` (currently 31)
- number of files in `Mathlib/` with `autoImplicit true` : `git grep -c "autoImplicit true" | grep -c "Mathlib"`
(For all files, `git grep -c "autoImplicit true" | wc -l` will also work.)
Again, there may be a number of files where `autoImplicit true` is used sensibly throughout the entire file - but in my experience removing this from files, most files do not use this intentionally, as it's just another small piece of technical debt.)
There is also #13038 that has more statistics.

For the reviewers, this is what the code would post right now:

|Number|Type|
|-:|:-|
| 7377 | porting notes |
| 74 | backwards compatibility flags |
| 77 | adaptation notes |
| 356 | disabled simpNF lints |
| 209 | disabled deprecation lints |
| 1891 | erw |
|41 | `Init` files |

<details><summary>5323 total LoC in 'Init' files</summary>

|LoC|File|
|-:|-|
|489|Mathlib/Init/Algebra/Classes.lean|
|249|Mathlib/Init/Align.lean|
|14|Mathlib/Init/Classes/Order.lean|
|37|Mathlib/Init/Classical.lean|
|85|Mathlib/Init/Control/Combinators.lean|
|264|Mathlib/Init/Control/Lawful.lean|
|172|Mathlib/Init/Core.lean|
|20|Mathlib/Init/Data/Bool/Basic.lean|
|155|Mathlib/Init/Data/Bool/Lemmas.lean|
|12|Mathlib/Init/Data/Buffer/Parser.lean|
|24|Mathlib/Init/Data/Fin/Basic.lean|
|123|Mathlib/Init/Data/Int/Basic.lean|
|16|Mathlib/Init/Data/Int/DivMod.lean|
|20|Mathlib/Init/Data/Int/Lemmas.lean|
|100|Mathlib/Init/Data/Int/Order.lean|
|67|Mathlib/Init/Data/List/Basic.lean|
|65|Mathlib/Init/Data/List/Instances.lean|
|183|Mathlib/Init/Data/List/Lemmas.lean|
|44|Mathlib/Init/Data/Nat/Basic.lean|
|14|Mathlib/Init/Data/Nat/Div.lean|
|132|Mathlib/Init/Data/Nat/GCD.lean|
|721|Mathlib/Init/Data/Nat/Lemmas.lean|
|11|Mathlib/Init/Data/Nat/Notation.lean|
|24|Mathlib/Init/Data/Option/Basic.lean|
|16|Mathlib/Init/Data/Option/Init/Lemmas.lean|
|67|Mathlib/Init/Data/Option/Lemmas.lean|
|45|Mathlib/Init/Data/Ordering/Basic.lean|
|61|Mathlib/Init/Data/Ordering/Lemmas.lean|
|12|Mathlib/Init/Data/Prod.lean|
|65|Mathlib/Init/Data/Quot.lean|
|17|Mathlib/Init/Data/Rat/Basic.lean|
|22|Mathlib/Init/Data/Sigma/Basic.lean|
|74|Mathlib/Init/Data/Sigma/Lex.lean|
|252|Mathlib/Init/Function.lean|
|670|Mathlib/Init/Logic.lean|
|27|Mathlib/Init/Meta/WellFoundedTactics.lean|
|469|Mathlib/Init/Order/Defs.lean|
|173|Mathlib/Init/Order/LinearOrder.lean|
|43|Mathlib/Init/Quot.lean|
|222|Mathlib/Init/Set.lean|
|47|Mathlib/Init/ZeroOne.lean|
|5323|total|

</details>
@grunweg would you like to add those to this PR? Or as a follow-up?

@jcommelin I'm happy to add them to either this PR or a follow-up. Given that it's PhD thesis crunch-time on my end, I'd like to not make promises about doing things *soon*. So, how about this: if I find time soon and this PR is still open, I'll add it here - otherwise, I file a follow-up PR?

Let's iterate fast. We'll merge this and add more later.

I'd love to see graphs, too. :-)
bors merge
Canceled.

### PR summary

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Diff of declarations

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>
I just pushed a commit adding the four metrics I proposed, not having seen the approval. Apologies if this cancelled the bors push.
Michael, I think that bors is struggling to merge a group of PRs with some conflicts among them, so even without your push this would have probably failed anyway.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9424297076/job/25964271200)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9424297076/job/25964271086)

```suggestion
printf '|%s | %s |\n' "$(grep -c 'docBlame' scripts/nolints.json)" "documentation nolint entries"
printf '|%s | %s |\n' "$(grep -c 'ERR_MOD' scripts/style-exceptions.txt)" "missing module docstrings"
printf '|%s | %s |\n' "$(grep -c 'ERR_NUM_LIN' scripts/style-exceptions.txt)" "large files"
```
That's even nicer, thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - ci: post a weekly report to zulip with some technical debt stats
